text: Are there any protections to stop serverless function being called by random users? Aside from doing manual methods for authentication if someone sniffs out an endpoing name what stops them from injecting random payloads using curl, or spamming our endpoint with requests which if we build up the methodology to authenticate wind up counting against our 600s of execution time.
Has anyone had issues with moving serverless functions to another folder?
after the move it still thinks they are in the same position and will not allow me to update my serveless.json file with the info.
